Meaning: A stakeholder is a person or group affected by a project or decision.
Example: We shared the plan with every stakeholder before starting.

Meaning: A roadmap is a plan that shows goals and steps over time.
Example: The product roadmap lists features for the next six months.

Meaning: Governance is how rules, roles, and decisions are managed in an organization.
Example: Good governance makes responsibilities clear for everyone.

Meaning: Compliance means following laws, rules, or standards.
Example: The team updated the process to meet compliance requirements.

Meaning: Scalability is the ability to grow and handle more work without failing.
Example: We improved scalability so the app can support more users.

Meaning: Interoperability is the ability of systems to work together and share data.
Example: Interoperability helps different tools exchange information easily.

Meaning: Architecture is the overall design of a system and how parts connect.
Example: The new architecture separates data storage from processing.

Meaning: Orchestration is coordinating many tasks or services to work as one process.
Example: Orchestration starts each service in the right order.

Meaning: Observability is how well you can understand a system using logs, metrics, and traces.
Example: Better observability helped us find the bug quickly.

Meaning: Resilience is the ability to recover after problems or failures.
Example: Resilience keeps the service running during small outages.

Meaning: Redundancy means having extra parts so a system still works if something fails.
Example: We added redundancy by using two servers instead of one.

Meaning: Throughput is how much work a system can handle in a given time.
Example: After the change, throughput increased during peak hours.

Meaning: Latency is the delay between a request and the response.
Example: High latency made the page feel slow.

Meaning: Instrumentation is adding tools to measure how a system behaves.
Example: Instrumentation lets us track errors and response times.

Meaning: Telemetry is data automatically collected from systems to monitor performance.
Example: Telemetry showed a spike in memory use after the update.

Meaning: Benchmarking is testing performance and comparing results to a standard.
Example: We used benchmarking to compare two database options.

Meaning: Optimization is improving something to work faster, cheaper, or better.
Example: Optimization reduced the time needed to process orders.

Meaning: Refactoring is changing code to make it cleaner without changing what it does.
Example: Refactoring made the code easier to maintain.

Meaning: Deprecation is when a feature is still available but planned to be removed later.
Example: We announced deprecation of the old API version.

Meaning: Migration is moving data, users, or systems from one place to another.
Example: The migration to the new server finished overnight.

Meaning: Modernization is updating systems or processes to use newer methods and tools.
Example: Modernization helped us replace old software safely.

Meaning: Containerization packages an app with its needs so it runs the same everywhere.
Example: Containerization made deployment faster and more consistent.

Meaning: Virtualization is running virtual machines on a physical computer.
Example: Virtualization let us run several servers on one machine.

Meaning: Provisioning is setting up resources like servers, accounts, or access.
Example: Provisioning a new environment takes only a few minutes now.

Meaning: Automation uses tools to do tasks with little human effort.
Example: Automation sends reports every morning automatically.

Meaning: Integration is connecting systems so they work together.
Example: The integration with payments reduced manual work.

Meaning: Consolidation is combining things into one to simplify management.
Example: Consolidation reduced costs by merging two platforms.

Meaning: Standardization means using the same rules or methods across a group.
Example: Standardization made training easier for new employees.

Meaning: Harmonization is making different policies or systems work well together.
Example: Harmonization aligned our teams on one set of terms.

Meaning: Segmentation is dividing users or markets into groups with similar needs.
Example: Segmentation helped us target messages to each group.

Meaning: Personalization is adapting content or services to an individual user.
Example: Personalization shows products based on your interests.

Meaning: Monetization is turning a product or service into a source of income.
Example: Monetization improved after we launched a paid plan.

Meaning: Profitability is the ability to make more money than you spend.
Example: Profitability increased when costs went down.

Meaning: Forecasting is predicting future results using current and past data.
Example: Forecasting suggests sales will rise next quarter.

Meaning: Valuation is estimating how much something is worth.
Example: The startup’s valuation grew after the new investment.

Meaning: Liquidity is how easily assets can be turned into cash.
Example: We kept extra cash to improve liquidity.

Meaning: Solvency is the ability to pay long-term debts and stay financially stable.
Example: Strong cash flow supports solvency during hard times.

Meaning: Amortization is paying off a loan in regular payments over time.
Example: The schedule shows amortization for the next five years.

Meaning: Capitalization is the total value of a company or the act of funding it.
Example: The company’s market capitalization rose after strong earnings.

Meaning: Arbitrage is making profit from price differences in different markets.
Example: Traders used arbitrage when the same asset had two prices.

Meaning: Procurement is the process of buying goods or services for a business.
Example: Procurement negotiated better prices with suppliers.

Meaning: Outsourcing is paying an outside company to do certain work.
Example: We used outsourcing for customer support during weekends.

Meaning: A partnership is a relationship where two sides work together for shared goals.
Example: The partnership with the vendor improved delivery times.

Meaning: Collaboration is working together to achieve a result.
Example: Collaboration between teams reduced duplicate work.

Meaning: Negotiation is discussing to reach an agreement.
Example: After negotiation, both sides accepted the new contract.

Meaning: Confidentiality means keeping information private and not sharing it.
Example: Employees signed a policy on confidentiality.

Meaning: Accountability means being responsible for actions and results.
Example: Accountability improved when owners were assigned to each task.

Meaning: Auditability is how easily actions can be checked and verified later.
Example: We improved auditability by keeping clear change logs.

Meaning: Attribution is identifying who caused or created a result.
Example: Attribution showed which campaign brought the new users.

Meaning: Differentiation is making something stand out from others.
Example: Our main differentiation is faster support and simpler pricing.
